task.shortdesc: Follow these instructions to fix a flat bike tyre.

context.p: This information will be helpful if you get a flat tyre while you're out for a cycle.

taskbody.prereq: Always carry a spare tube, repair kit, tyre levers and a pump to change a tyre. See this list

step.tutorialinfo: Removing the wheel is a 2-step process.
step.steptroubleshooting: Check manufacturer instruction if you're unable to complete these steps.

step.tutorialinfo: You need to remove the tube from the tyre to find the source of the puncture.

substep.cmd: Release the remaining air from your tyre by depressing the small plunger in the center of your tyre valve.
Unseat your tyre by pushing one bead edge in toward the center of the rim.
Remove the inflatable tube from beneath the tyre by pulling the valve stem out through the rim.

messagepanel.typeofhazard: The sharp edge of the rim may cause damage when pulling the valve out through the rim.
messagepanel.howtoavoid: Carefully remove the inflatable tube from beneath the tyre by pulling the valve stem out through the rim first.

cmd.b: Find The Cause Of Your Flat Tyre

step.tutorialinfo: When searching for the cause of a flat tyre, begin on the outside and work your way in.

substep.cmd: Check the outer surface of the tyre for any signs of damage or wear.
Check the inner tube and the inside surface of the tyre for damage.

step.steptroubleshooting: You can leave the tyre in its location on the wheel to check for tyre damage once the tube leak is discovered.

step.tutorialinfo: Most commercial patching kits contain everything you need to create an effective patch in the field.

substep.cmd: Clean and dry the damaged area.
Rough up the surface of the damaged area with sandpaper (to help the glue adhere).
Spread the glue (vulcanizing fluid) and allow it to set until tacky.
Apply the tube patch and hold it in place with pressure.

cmd.b: Put Your Tube and Tyre Back On

step.tutorialinfo: Check manufacturer instruction if you're unable to complete these steps

substep.cmd: Starting with the valve stem, lower the tube onto the wheel and insert the valve into the rim valve hole.
Place the rest of the tube inside the tyre.
If you completely removed your tyre from the rim, proceed around the wheel working the tyre bead inside the rim.
Inflate the tyre slowly to its recommended pressure.
substep.info: Recommended pressure is printed on the tyre itself or in your owner manual.

taskbody.result: The tyre has been fixed and you're ready to go.
